text: was the founder of Shotokan, which is the most widely known school or style of karate. He is known as the "father of modern karate".Japan Karate Association (JKA), "Supreme Master Funakoshi Gichin (1868-1957) ; excerpt,"Shoto was the literary first name he used when doing calligraphy and writing poetry. Shoto means “Pine Waves,” and refers to the sound of wind blowing through the pines"; retrieved 2012-11-9. Funakoshi died on 26 April 1957 in Tokyo of colon cancer, aged 88. ==Selected works== In an overview of writings by and about Funakoshi, OCLC/WorldCat lists roughly 30+ works in 60+ publications in 8 languages and 1,800+ library holdings. WorldCat Identities: Funakoshi, Gichin 1870-1956; retrieved 2012-11-9. :This list is not finished; you can help Wikipedia by adding to it. * 唐手術: 錬胆護身, 1925 * 空手道教範, 1935 * 空手道一路, 1956 * Karate-Do Kyohan: The Master Text, 1973 * The Twenty Guiding Principles of Karate: The Spiritual Legacy of the Master, 1975 * Karate-Do: My Way of Life, 1975 * Karate-Do Nyumon: The Master Introductory Text. 1988 * Karate Jutsu: The Original Teachings of Master Funakoshi, 2001 * The Essence of Karate, 2010 ==References== ==Other websites== * Funakoshi, Gichin, 1870-1956 at Virtual International Authority File Category:1868 births Category:1957 deaths Category:Deaths from colorectal cancer Category:Japanese martial artists Category:20th-century Ryukyuan people
title: Gichin Funakoshi
